summary: This is an email chain between Assistant United States Attorneys in the Southern District of New York regarding the preservation and acquisition of surveillance video from July 22-23, 2019, related to the case of Jeffrey Epstein and inmate Nicholas Tartaglione. The video was requested by the defense and is being obtained from the Special Investigative Services (SIS).

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender and recipient of the email chain, working on the Epstein/Tartaglione case, coordinating the acquisition of surveillance video.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the case; the surveillance video from July 22-23, 2019, is related to him.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Named alongside Epstein in the context of the surveillance video from July 22-23, 2019.

connections.description: Both are mentioned together in the context of a surveillance video from their time in custody on July 22-23, 2019.
The AUSA is working on the case involving Jeffrey Epstein and is seeking evidence (surveillance video) related to him.

events.title: Epstein/Tartaglione Surveillance Video
events.description: Surveillance video was recorded of Jeffrey Epstein and Nicholas Tartaglione in custody. The defense requested its preservation, and the prosecution is working to obtain a viewable copy from Special Investigative Services (SIS).

events.title: Initial Video Copy Provided
events.description: SIS provided a copy of the surveillance video to the prosecution, but it lacked the necessary player and could not be converted.

events.title: Email Coordination on Video
events.description: Prosecutors correspond about the status of obtaining a working copy of the July 22-23 surveillance video from SIS.

keyFacts: The defense in the Epstein case requested preservation of surveillance video from July 22-23, 2019, featuring Epstein and inmate Nicholas Tartaglione.
Special Investigative Services (SIS) saved a copy of the video and confirmed it works on their systems, but the prosecution has not yet viewed it.
An initial copy provided to prosecutors on December 20, 2019, was not usable due to a missing player, requiring a new copy.
The email chain demonstrates active evidence gathering by the U.S. Attorney's Office in the Southern District of New York regarding Epstein's time in custody.
